Well, that explains it.  Thanks!  :)

Frank


Michael Stack wrote:
> 
> 
> As Mark says, ARCs are the concatenation of individual pages GZIPped (A
> product made of concatenated GZIP'd files -- or 'members' in gzip speak
> -- is itself a legal GZIP file according to the gzip RFC).
> 
> Whats happening when you gunzip is that all of the individual GZIP
> records are being undone. When you then turn around gzip the ungzipped,
> its compressing without respect for page boundaries. The compression is
> better because the blocks being compressed are, likely, generally larger
> than when we adhere to our usual GZIP member per single page rule.
> 
> The ARCReader expects to get an ARC of concatenated GZIPped records. It
> has no handling of a big GZIP lump built-in (though it'd be easy enough
> to add). Its supposed to reject GZIP files that don't have special GZIP
> extensions that signify its been made with an ARC Writer but according
> to your stacktrace below, this is the very spot we're failing; try ing
> to test for the presence of the ARC gzip extension (I've just made a
> commit so we should fail properly going forward).
> 
> Frank, you might check out this section from the developer manual on
> ARCs: http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#arcs. 
> <http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#arcs.>
> St.Ack
> 
> Frank McCown wrote:
>  >
>  > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>
>  > <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>, mark <mark@...> wrote:
>  > >
>  > > Hi,
>  > >
>  > > arc files are gzip'd:
>  > >
>  > > http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/gzip.htm 
> <http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/gzip.htm>
>  > <http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/gzip.htm 
> <http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/gzip.htm>>
>  > >
>  > > each record is a separate gzip item (which when concatenated together
>  > > make a valid gzip file).
>  >
>  > I'm probably doing something stupid, but I've noticed that if I unzip
>  > an arc.gz file using gzip 1.3 on Solaris and then zip it back up, the
>  > file size is much smaller than the original arc.gz file.
>  >
>  > This is how I am decompressing/compressing:
>  >
>  > gzip -d test.arc.gz
>  > gzip test.arc
>  >
>  > arcreader (supplied with Heritrix) will work fine the original
>  > test.arc.gz and test.arc. But if I use it on the re-compressed (and
>  > smaller) test.arc.gz, I get this error:
>  >
>  > >arcreader test.arc.gz
>  > Exception processing test.arc.gz: null
>  > java.lang.NullPointerException
>  > at
>  > org.archive.io.arc.ARCUtils.testCompressedARCStream(ARCUtils.java:135)
>  > at
>  > org.archive.io.arc.ARCUtils.testCompressedARCFile(ARCUtils.java:106)
>  > at
>  > org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory.get(ARCReaderFactory.java:117)
>  > at
>  > org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory.get(ARCReaderFactory.java:89)
>  > at
>  > org.archive.io.arc.ARCReaderFactory.get(ARCReaderFactory.java:79)
>  > at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.output(ARCReader.java:932)
>  > at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.main(ARCReader.java:1276)
>  >
>  > Any ideas?
>  > Frank
>  >
>  >
